title: Dynamic Routing
subject: React
theory:
## Paths with Variables
Often you need routes like `/user/1` or `/product/50`.

### Params
Use `:paramName` in the route definition.
`<Route path="/user/:id" element={<User />} />`

### Accessing Params
Use `useParams()` hook inside the component.

common_mistakes.correction: In V6, algorithm automatically picks best match. In usage with other libs, specific routes should usually come before wildcard routes.

real_world_use_cases.description: Clicking product list item delegates to /product/:id

exam_notes: useParams returns string (parse to int if needed).
summary: Dynamic routing enables data-driven navigation structures.
